clinical_study.brief_title: Prayer in Commbate to Corona Virus - Covid -19
clinical_study.official_title: A Double Blind, Controlled, Randomized, Prospective Study That Will Evaluate the Impact of Remote Intercession Prayer on the Clinical Evolution of Patients Diagnosed With COVID -19 in HCOR.

brief_summary.textblock: PATIENTS WHO ARE ADMITTED TO HOSPITALIZATION IN HCOR AND WHO HAVE THE CONFIRMED DIAGNOSIS OF CORONA VIRUS, WILL BE ASKED TO CONSENT TO PARTICIPATE IN THIS STUDY THAT INTENDS TO STUDY THE EFFECTIVENESS OF THE REMOTE INTERCESSION PRAYER IN COMBATING THIS DISEASE.

detailed_description.textblock:
PATIENTS WHO AGREE TO PARTICIPATE IN THE STUDY WILL BE SEPARATED INTO 2 GROUPS, THE INTERVENTION GROUP AND THE CONTROL GROUP.
THE IDENTITY OF THE PATIENTS WILL BE KEPT IN SECRET AND ONLY THEIR INITIALS WILL BE LISTED.
THE INTERVENTION GROUP WILL RECEIVE DAILY PRAYERS AND THE EVOLUTIONARY CLINICAL RESULTS OF THE TWO GROUPS WILL BE PURCHASED.

primary_outcome.description: WE WILL EVALUATE DEATHS OR HOSPITAL DISCHARGE

secondary_outcome.description: Occurrence of clinical complications that were not included before diagnostic confirmation and that may be related to covid infection.

arm_group.description: THIS GROUP WILL RECEIVE THE PROTCOLL TREATMENT GIVEN TO PATIENTS COVID -POSITIVE TESTED.
THIS GROUP WILL RECEIVE THE SAME TREATMENT GIVEN TO THE CONTROL GROUP, PLUS PRAYERS BY THEOLOGIANS WHOSE PRAYERS INTERCEDE IN FAVOR OF THEIR PROMPT RECOVERY

intervention.description: THE PRAYER GROUP WILL RECEIVE ABSOLUTELY THE SAME CARE AS THE CONTROL GROUP PLUS PRAYERS

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
Patients hospitalized in comun hospital rooms and intensive care units with confirmed COVID-19.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Patients admitted to the HCor emergency room, diagnosed with COVID-19 infection, however, without indication for hospitalization
- Patients admitted to the HCor emergency room, diagnosed with COVID-19 infection, however, without indication for hospitalization.
- Patients 18 years of age or older
- Patients with indication of palliative care and definition of terminality at hospital admission
